title: Conservation of energy-block on ramp with friction

content.question: A block is released from rest at the top of a rough ramp. There is significant friction between the block and the ramp, but the blockâ€™s speed increases as the block slides down the ramp. Which of the following correctly indicates whether the total mechanical energy of the block-Earth system decreases or remains the same, and provides a valid justification?

choices.label: Decreases, because a force external to the system is dissipating energy
Decreases, because the gravitational potential energy of the system decreases
Stays the same because energy is always conserved
Stays the same because gravitational potential energy is converted into kinetic energy

content.answer: Decreases, because a force external to the system is dissipating energy

skill.text: 3.C: Justify or support a claim using evidence from experimental data, physical representations, or physical principles or laws.
